title: DIY paintcan pyrolysis kiln for making biochar during dry distillation.

tasks.task: Construct a pyrolysis kiln for creating biochar or converting materials into oil.
subtasks: Obtain a turkey fryer with a variable regulator.
Procure a one-gallon paint can and reinforce its lid with a bulkhead fitting, compression fitting, and copper tube for condensation.
Insulate the five-gallon paint container and reinforce its bottom with cement board and drywall screws to create a stable heat spreader.
Assemble the reactor vessel by placing the prepared lid over the insulated paint can, ensuring even heat distribution via the reinforced spreader plate.
Position the burner at the bottom of the reactor vessel, allowing the flame to heat the spreader plate and impart even heat to the reaction vessel.
Collect and channel condensate from the process into a designated container for utilizing the byproducts such as wood vinegar or oil.
